Summary: Not worth the money that I paid for. If they‚Äôre going to charge so much for a room the least they can do is buy some cleaning supplies to clean up this place. Staff is very friendly, but the rooms and restrooms are disgusting and smell weird.There‚Äôs stains on the walls restroom curtains are really dirty furniture is super old. NOT what it looks like on pictures, and we were supposed to get a ‚ÄúDeluxe‚Äù room. The bed sheets had holes. I‚Äôm glad I brought my own blankets from home. The walls throughout the room were disgustingly dirty. The fridge and microwave are inside the bathroom also had an odd smell to it. Do not recommend this place at all. If you‚Äôre looking for something around $140 look for another place. I‚Äôm sorry but this place was a regret 100% specially if you‚Äôre

Summary Heading: A Gem in Sleepy Seal Beach
Summary: The Pacific Inn may have long ago lost its "new car smell," but this quaint property does not fail to impress.  The front desk team called days in advance to ensure that arrival needs were met-- and they were.  The small hotel, a block of off the quiet section of the PCH, boasted amenities like a private shuttle, pool, work out area, breakfast, covered on-site free parking-- and most importantly an easy walk to groceries, dining and Seal Beach's Main Street and beach.  The Admiral's Suite was spacious with a living room, equipped wet bar/ kitchen, bedroom and large bath area. (Modest folks will notice the lack of a door between the bath area and the bedroom. However, the commode area had some privacy.) The room had a huge wrap-around balcony for the common area and a private

Older, but always clean!  They have new beds, and I slept like a dream!  I love having a little fridge, freezer and microwave.  This was perfect both times (and I'm using them again in a few months) b/c I don't live in the room, I just want to sleep, and shower.   NEVER have had noises too loud and I've always felt safe!  Minutes from everywhere I want to go too.  Close to several freeways.
Room tip: Quiet, clean, comfortable bed, close to freeways, fridge & microwave.

Summary: We stayed here 1 night after dropping off our rental car. The hotel shuttle quickly picked us up and delivered us to the hotel. We were exhausted and had colds, and they let us check in at noon and sleep. The unit was small but clean and bed was comfortable. They have free 24 hr airport shuttle service with congenial drivers. We drove 0.8 mi to the old time Tiki Bar for a good dinner. This is not luxury, but totally adequate, clean and inexpensive.

Summary Heading: Not a Bad Place if your on a budget
Summary: Friendly staff, the house keepers were friendly as well. The room was nice and tidy, bed comfortable and there was a mini fridge and microwave to use. Its a decent hike to Disneyland, but close to super markets, wall mart etc... Overall not a bad little place. I can be a little hard to spot as it is tucked in between other motels with bigger signs.

We had difficulty finding this motel. It is closer to Knott's Berry Farm over Disneyland.  The check in lobby smelled of urine.  The hotel does not have a lift of any sort for the second floor, therefore consider this if climbing stairs is an issue.  They did move us to a lower level room for the rest of our stay after the first night. The room did have a microwave and mini fridge in each room.  The beds were not the most comfortable but they certainly were not the worst either.  There was mold/mildew about the size of a quarter in the bathroom, which was concerning.  The bathtub faucet was broken but they did get a plumber to fix it.   The floors were absolutely gross.  I do not believe that they clean their flooring regularly.  Our son's feet would end up covered in black
Room tip: no elevator so if one cannot walk a staircase then one will need a first floor room

Summary: Very well priced for those travelling on a budget and the beds... They are ridiculously comfortable.  The room is not too big and the air conditioning unit is quite awkwardly placed but for the price of the stay,  this can be overlooked rather easily.

They definitely need a paint job but the place was clean.  It looked like they were renovating at the other end of the hotel.  A little ways off for the main trail but not bad.  Management was over the top helpful!

My business partner and I stay here every year for an expo we attend.  Rick is super friendly and will make any accommodation you need.   I don't understand the bad reviews on here.  It has always been very clean and we have been coming for four years.  Sure, it is small, but for the price what do you expect??  We can rent two rooms for less than half the price of something near the convention center.  If you are coming to Anaheim for vacation and you can't stand paying 200 a night for a room, book with Rick.  You won't regret it.

This is definitely the worst hotel I've been.  The service is very poor, dirty, internet works very bad, old and dirty furniture, after the cleaning all my clothes were on the floor, noisy, no air drier not even a hook to hang a jacket... should I continue?

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for but management is pretty nice.
Summary: While the exterior of the motel looks decent, the inside of the room needs a serious paint job.  A little out of the way for Disneyland, but it's a place to stay for a few days.  The beds are extremely stiff but after a day at Disneyland or Knott's, you'll definitely fall asleep pretty quickly.  Rick was really super nice and told me that if I needed anything, he would be manning the motel office all night.  I wish I could say the same thing for his wife as she was a little curt with me when I checked out.

Summary Heading: Pretty good for a motel under $100 a night
Summary: Man at front desk was really friendly to us. Room was nice and clean to what I could see. Internet was good. We walked to Knotts Berry Farm, took 30mins. Handy microwave & fridge. Would recommend it to others. Walmart is only probably 15min walk away which was handy. üëç

We booked this place because of the high score on booking.com, but unfortunately, this place doesn‚Äôt deserve its score. Firstly, the room was not well kept, but most importantly, the sanitation of the room became minuscule compare to the service we received.  Upon arrival, Rick checked us in and was very friendly. We booked a room for a few nights because we had plans to go to Disneyland. On the last night after coming back from Disneyland which closes at 12 am, we went to our room and discovered that both keycards had failed. We went to the office and saw their sign to ‚Äúring the bell for assistance,‚Äù and so we proceeded to do as so, we even called them too, but no one came. This went on for 3 hours from when we got back from Disneyland at 1 am to 4 am. We called booking.com to

My husband and I stayed the weekend and I was very pleased with how nice the staff was and how clean everything was. We had a small problem with a TV whom someone had broken while they occupied the room before us and the staff moved us Into another room without even having to be asked. I will be staying there again for any future trips :)

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for, but it's good for just a quick sleep
Summary: Not a bad place if you're just looking to sleep there, we've stayed twice before.   Our first stay was in 2013, late summer. The AC in the units don't work that great in the summer, but they serve their purpose. We were only there 2 nights this trip as it was just a day trip to Disney. The drive to Disney from here is great. Only takes about 10 minutes using back streets and you can get right to Mickey & Friends easily. The staff at the hotel has always been great.   Our second stay was earlier this year in February. We stayed 6 nights this time as it was a much longer trip. Same as before, the room was decent, clean enough. Beds are not super comfortable, but they're not terrible either. Bring your own blankets though as theirs are not very soft. They're itchy.   This last trip

You get what you paid for. Here are the pros: cheap, 15 away from Disneyland so I didn't have to pay the "Disneyland fee", beds were comfortable(firm), flatscreen tvs with directv so we got to watch our show on Sunday. Now time for the cons: the area doesn't look too friendly, when I opened the door of the hotel it smell kind of funny, when I went in to take a shower there were large amounts of hair in the bath tub. Other than that it's really you get what you paid for

Summary Heading: Run, Run as fast as you can!!! Your Things will be stolen here!!!
Summary: This place is horrible!!! For starter, my card was charged before I even checked in and I was planning to pay in cash to split the cost between me and my friend. I found hair everywhere on my pillow case in the bathroom and in the sheets. The room smelled like fart!! Disgusting!!! On top of everything, my things were stolen!!! 2 pair of contacts-one colored and a brand new package not even opened.  Both prescription and worth about $30 a pair-- come on who steal contacts!!!! A pair of Beats headphones and a bracelet bought at Disney land-- all together worth about $150-$175. I had to fight with the management to get them to refund anything. The owner kept saying her maid didn't touch anything. Like hell she didn't!! Then where did my stuff go?? Also she had me help her dig thru

Summary Heading: Very Inexpensive, Not For Everyone (Not For Me)
Summary: I checked in but discovered this was not what I expected nor desired so I checked out right away and did not spend the night. It is hard to rate this property because comparing it to more expensive places I usually stay would result in much lower ratings. Here are my observations:  $50/night is hard to beat. If you pay in advance you will not get a refund if you cancel or change your mind. The rooms are quite small and they only offer one queen-size bed in each room. The beds are VERY firm.  Rooms have a small fridge, microwave, and older TV (I am told they are upgrading to flat-screens after the summer) Towels are smallish and thinner. The soaps I opened immediately crumbled into pieces. You may need to request newer soap. My sink had low water pressure. Management was

My husband and I booked on line to stay at Pacific Inn for 1 week out of our 2 week vacation. The rooms are clean and offer a microwave and small refrigerator. Which is perfect for breakfast or lunch in your room or leftovers later on. The rooms are a bit dated but very comfortable!  The owners here Rick and his wife are fantastic! If you need some extra hangers or towels they are so happy and accommodating !  The owners here make you feel at home. so at home we cancelled the other hotel we were going to stay at for the second week and the other hotel offered a pool! But with the hospitality here and the owners making you feel special we skipped the pool! We will be back! The room rates cant be beat! Thank you Mr. & Mrs. Jeff Brennan

I've given the Pacific Inn 5 stars, not becuase it's like the Ritz Calton but because the quality of the accomodation far exceeded my expectations and in my opinion was an absolute bargain.  We were looking for somewhere inexpensive to stay whilst visting Disneyland as we knew we would be out most of the day/night and bookd this motel based on the price and reviews.  It is a classic motel, one long row of rooms over two stories all with entrances directly from outside and ample parking below.  Travelling time to disneyland is circa 15 minutes in the car.  This was a bit of a different experience for us as we had never stayed in a motel before however we did not feel unsafe at all so no worries there.  Our room was reasonably large with a big bed and small kitchen area with a

Found this place on Booking.com and saw that the reviews were pretty good for the price. So my boyfriend and I chose this to stay when I visited for a week. The rooms are small. Decor on inside is outdated. Older T.V with basic cable which wasn't a big problem since we were out all day. Most of the room is clean. They could use some deep cleaning as there was mold on the celling above the shower. There was also some mold along the top of the tile in the shower and around the inside of the sink. Parking is great and its quiet. Food and entertainment near by. Not a far drive to the 91 for access to other parts of the metroplex. The beach is just a 30 minute drive east down Beach Blvd. The owner is really nice as others have mentioned. the room is great if you need a place to sleep

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel, Good Location, Good Price!
Summary: Hotel rooms are good enough and neat and clean. Has good amount of toiletries, microwave, refrigerator, Wifi internet. Parking was enough for number of rooms present in the hotel. Hotel owner is a Gujrati (Indian) and a nice man.   There is no option of breakfast in the hotel, so in the morning we went to nearby Subway (open 24 hrs). It is quite close to attractions: Knotty Beery Farm, Disneyland.

Manager was very nice. Bed was comfy, bathroom was big, and had a nice array of toiletries, a microwave and fridge. Very decent price and very quiet. Near all the attractions. Will definatly be staying here again when I visit CA.

Summary Heading: Lovely clean and well presented motel.
Summary: Stayed for three nights in July. Booked through booking.com. Asked to stay an extra night on arrival, no problem in doing so.  Owner Rick was extremely nice and accommodating. He outlined all the amenities in the area and booked a tour with Grayline for us. A good lesson in hosting skills!  The room was clean as was the fridge and bathroom. The a/c unit was a bit outdated, but it worked perfectly. The decor could do with an update in keeping with the newly refurbished outside. Didn't take away from the stay.  The wifi was excellent and parking was perfect. Very good value.

Summary Heading: Simply  and effective with the best price
Summary: What are you looking for, after enjoying an entire day at Disney ? A  clean bedroom to rest, as much as possible,  your body in order to spend the day after again at Disney. We've found this in Pacific Inn Hotel Anaheim, with a great price and with a  simpatic and helpful owner.

Summary Heading: Best value hotel in the area
Summary: I have stayed twice at this hotel and find it hard to fault especially for the price.  As my child is at University in Long Beach there have been many times when I've had to find accommodation so I've tried a few - the last one being The Queen Mary - where once was enough.  And I'm quite picky about the sort of place I want to stay in and in this area it's hard to find somewhere that ticks at least 75% of my boxes. The Pacific Inn did that.  Parking and WiFi are free - big bonuses when most of the other hotels charge up to $20pn alone for parking.  It's clean.  Comfortable rooms that are light and well sized with nice bedding (a deal breaker for me). Easy to get to with well lit areas which as I'm an alone traveller is important - I need to feel safe.  Good room sizes with

Summary Heading: Great stop, nice owner, low price
Summary: I arrived late, 11:45 pm, and Rick the onsite owner couldn't have been nicer.  He helped me get my luggage into my room and explained everything.  As the reviews say, this is a basic place with small rooms.  But, it was clean and just what I needed.

Summary Heading: Very nice folks, clean room and low price
Summary: Stayed a week at this property.  It is a two star property in a good central location.  Rooms were clean and included a microwave, small refrigerator and TV.  We enjoyed our time there and Rick the onsite owner gave us some money saving tips and was very welcoming.  The room was cleaned daily and we spent most of our time out playing in the area.  Not pretenious or upscale just a nice clean room at a fair price to sleep and use as a home base while exploring Orange County and LA.  Thanks Rick

Dropped in just for 1 night being in a bind but ended staying here the rest of my trip!! Front Desk was so friendly & helpful. Yes the rooms are a bit small but very clean, has micro and fridge & bathrooms look newly remodeled. Low key and quiet location besides a little noise from the street. Very pleased with my stay so I highly recommend it (especially with the price!!) and will stay again.

This is a basic motel.  Rooms are tiny.  You can hear road traffic noise but it is not too bad.  Room has fridge and microwave.  Heater air conditioner works great.  Restaurant choices nearby are scarce.  Drug store right next door.  Disneyland is a 10 minute drive.  I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: clean and frindly wil go back !
Summary: The hotel owner lives there and is always available to help.  I am imn a wheelchair and he helped me load my chair in the car whenever I needed it.  The cleaning lady was always here and would bring towels when needed
